item.title: Regulating Unwanted Smart Device Traffic Using PiHole and Edgerouter X
item.description: 98% of smart assistants and 72% of smart TVs use hard coded DNS servers. 1 The inclusion of ads on smart TVs even by well known brands like Samsung, Sony and LG (archive) significantly increases the need for forced DNS adblocking of devices that deliberately ignore DHCP provided DNS. A Pihole DNS by itself can prevent ads from devices that are well behaved, but misbehaving devices will have to be forced by either a firewall or router.

item.title: Improved way of rendering TeX math in Hugo
item.description:
Lincoln Atkinson wrote a post about TeX math typesetting in Hugo (archive) where he described a solution that could do TeX math typesetting with and without Javascript enabled.

I have improved slightly upon his method, creating a simple Python script to download the equation images prior to publication and serving them from the local web server.
